info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 30 at 6:26PM EDT until May 30 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
At 626 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Numerous roads were reported to be flooded across the area. There was also a water rescue reported north of Worthington. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fairmont, Mannington, Pleasant Valley, Barrackville, Monongah, Fairview, Hundred, Cassville, Rivesville, Grant Town, Farmington, Worthington, Rachel, Metz, Idamay, Carolina, Wadestown, Daybrook, Wana and McCurdyville.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR MARION, NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA AND EASTERN WETZEL COUNTIES
NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 8:30 PM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 8:30 PM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

area.areaDesc: Marion, WV; Monongalia, WV; Wetzel, WV

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR MARION, NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA AND EASTERN WETZEL COUNTIES
SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 8:30 PM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 8:30 PM EDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
